result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Ford in court, in custody.  Attorney Lane Fitzgerald in court for James Ford.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court Defendant stands mute. Court enters a not guilty plea. Speedy trial rights reserved. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Ford Jr in court.   Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Adjourned. State is asking for more time, waiting for follow-up from arresting agency. Defendant is on a PO hold. defendant is to file court appointed attorney paperwork. Minutes filed.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 1:15 PM. Defendant James Ford Jr in court, in custody. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Obi Uzowulu for bond purposes only. Discussion as to bond. Defendant is on probation hold. Court sets bond at $5000 cash. Minutes filed.
